meanings.sent2: The troops defended the country bravely.
meanings.sent3: The troops shared stories around the campfire.
meanings.sent4: The troops were a shield against danger.
meanings.sent5: The troops stood tall and proud on the battlefield.

meanings.definition: A group of people or animals
meanings.sent1: A large troops of tourists visited the museum.
meanings.sent2: The troops of monkeys played in the jungle.
meanings.sent3: The troops of children giggled and ran around the playground.
meanings.sent4: The troops of penguins waddled gracefully on the ice.
meanings.sent5: The troops of fans cheered loudly at the concert.

meanings.definition: To gather or move in a crowd or group
meanings.sent1: The students troops into the auditorium for the assembly.
meanings.sent2: People troops around the street performer to watch the show.
meanings.sent3: The birds troops together on the power lines, chirping happily.
meanings.sent4: Dark clouds troops in the sky, signaling an incoming storm.
meanings.sent5: The ants troops in a line, carrying food back to their nest.
